docs.snippet: Increased buying of the Canadian free dollar to put it fractionally higher on the week, and an irregular trend in the Argentina peso which put that unit at the lowest since April, 1943, were the only diversions of an otherwise firm array of values...
docs.lead_paragraph: Increased buying of the Canadian free dollar to put it fractionally higher on the week, and an irregular trend in the Argentina peso which put that unit at the lowest since April, 1943, were the only diversions of an otherwise firm array of values for the foreign currencies last week.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 4 -- Both The Associated Press and The United Press have been hard hit by yesterday's Argentine Government decree compelling all radio stations to subscribe to the service of the Government news agency, Andi.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 6 -Notwithstanding loss of their European markets, Latin-American republics exported goods of a higher aggregate value in 1942 than in any years since 1937, and during 1943 they exported more than $1,300,000,000 worth of goods to...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 6 -Notwithstanding loss of their European markets, Latin-American republics exported goods of a higher aggregate value in 1942 than in any years since 1937, and during 1943 they exported more than $1,300,000,000 worth of goods to the United States, a still greater increase.

docs.snippet: FROM Havana comes word that Cuba is issuing a 3-centavos purple stamp (quantity, 2,000,000) to mark the centenary of the death of Gabriel de la Concepcion Valdes, who, known as "Placido," was one of Cuba's popular poets. A newcomer to philately's...
docs.lead_paragraph: FROM Havana comes word that Cuba is issuing a 3-centavos purple stamp (quantity, 2,000,000) to mark the centenary of the death of Gabriel de la Concepcion Valdes, who, known as "Placido," was one of Cuba's popular poets. A newcomer to philately's gallery, he was born in Havana on March 18, 1809.
docs.abstract: Cuba: G de la C Valdes commem stamp described; illus

docs.snippet: Strength in the Canadian free dollar featured business in the foreign exchange market last week. In the early trading the Dominion currency was valued around 89.38 cents, but beginning on Thursday and continuing for the remainder of the week buying...
docs.lead_paragraph: Strength in the Canadian free dollar featured business in the foreign exchange market last week. In the early trading the Dominion currency was valued around 89.38 cents, but beginning on Thursday and continuing for the remainder of the week buying orders in good volume drove the price up to 89.93 cents, highest since Dec. 28, last. Saturday's closing price of 89.87 cents, reflected a gain of 7/16 cent over the preceding week.

docs.snippet: A shortage of newsprint is one of the "most acute" problems in South America today because it deprives the people of a full knowledge of world events, Alfredo Silva of Valparaiso, Chile, publisher and editor of La Union, declared here yesterday.
